intro: Descurainia pinnata subsp. intermedia, commonly known as the narrowleaf tansy, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in racemes, typical of the mustard family. It is native to North America and thrives in dry, open habitats such as prairies and roadsides. Its botanical features make it identifiable by its distinct leaf morphology and floral structure.
